gurmukhi: dwVn swiQ cbwie geI kil Aaur ghy chUM Er bgwey ]
transliteration: Daadan Saath(i) Chabade Gado Kal(i) Aur Gade Chahoon Or Bagade||
translation: Kali chewed many with her molars, and had thrown asunder many of them in all the four directions.

gurmukhi: rwvn so irs kY rn mY piq Bwlk ijau igr rwj clwey ]185]
transliteration: Raavan So Ris Kai Ran Mai Pat(i) Dhaalak Jio Gir Raaj Chadhaae||185||
translation: It seemed that while fighting with Ravana, in great fury, Jamwant had picked up and destroyed the great mountains.185.

gurmukhi: Pyr lY pwn kiRpwn sMBwr kY dYqn so bhu ju`Du kirE hY ]
transliteration: Pher Lai Paan Kridaan Sanbhaar Kai Daitan So Bahu Juddh(u) Kario Hai||
translation: Then taking the sword in her hand, Kali hath waged a ferocious war with the demons.

gurmukhi: mwr ibdwr sMGwr dey bhu BUm pry Bt sRaun JirE hY ]
transliteration: Maar Bidaar Sanhaar Dae Bahu Bhoom Dare Bhat Sraoun Jhario Hai||
translation: She hath destroyed many, who are lying dead on the earth and the blood is oozing out of the corpses.

gurmukhi: gUd bihE Ar sIsn qy kiv ny iqh ko ieh Bwau DirE hY ]
transliteration: Good Bahio Ar Soosan Te Kav(i) Ne Tih Ko Ih Bhaau Dhario Hai||
translation: The marrow, which is flowing from the heads of the enemies, the poet hath thought about it in this way:

gurmukhi: mwno phwr ko siRMghu qy DrnI pr Awn quswr pirE hY ]186]
transliteration: Maano Pahaar Ko Sringaddd Te Dharnoo Par Aan Tousaar Pario Hai||186||
translation: In seemed that slipping down from the peak of the mountain, the snow hath fallen on the earth.186.

gurmukhi: Bwj geI DujnI sBY rihE n kCU aupwau ]
transliteration: Bhaaj Gado Dhujnoo Sabhai Rahio Na Kachhodh Oupaao||
translation: When no other remedy was left, all the forces of the demons fled away.

gurmukhi: suMB insuMBih so kihE dlu lY qum hUM jwau ]187]
transliteration: Sounbh Nisounbhah(i) So Kahio Dal(u) Lai Toum Hoon Jaao||187||
translation: At that time Sumbh said to Nisumbh: “Take the army and go to fight.”187.

gurmukhi: mwn kY suMBu ko bol insuMBu cilE dl swj mhwN bl AYsy ]
transliteration: Maan Kai Sounbh(u) Ko Bol Nisounbh(u) Chadio Dal Saaj Mahaan Bal Aise||
translation: Obeying the orders of Sumbh, the mighty Nisumbh hath arrayed and moved forward like this:

gurmukhi: BwrQ ijau rn mY irs pwrQ kRu`D kY ju`D kirE krnY sy ]
transliteration: Bhaarath Jio Ran Ma Iris Paarath Kruddh Kai Juddh Kario Karnai Se||
translation: Just as in the war of Mahabharata, Arjuna, filled with anger had fought with Karan.

gurmukhi: cMif ky bwn lgy bhu dYq kau Poir kY pwr Bey qn kYsy ]
transliteration: Channd(i0 Ke Baan Lage Bahu Dait Kau Phor(i) Kai Paar Bhae Tan Kaise||
translation: The arrows of Chandi struck the demon in great number, which pierced and crossed the body, how?

gurmukhi: swvx mws kiRswn ky Kyq augy mno Dwn ky AMkur jYsy ]188]
transliteration: Saavan Maas Kridaan Ke Khet Ouge Mano Dhaan Ke Ankur Jaise||188||
translation: Just as the young shoots of paddy in the field of a farmer in the rainy month of Sawan.188.
